settings.title: Same day GP appointments online
Appointments from home, work or wherever's comfortable

Get medical advice, referrals and prescriptions
Private GP Appointments Online
settings.subtitle: Book a private GP appointment online with a GMC-registered and NHS-trained doctor today. Same-day doctor's appointments are available from only £35.

settings.title: Book a time and date
settings.text: Select a time and date for your GP appointment to take place. This wil be at a time most convenient for you with avaialability online 7 days a week.

settings.title: Checkout Securely
settings.text: Once you have completed your consultation and selected your treatment, you can securely checkout online.

settings.title: Express Delivery
settings.text: You will then receive your order the next working day using our express next-day courier service, dispensed from one of our verified GhPC partner pharmacies in the UK.

settings.title: How to book an online GP appointment
Healthcare When You Need It
settings.text:
Now you can receive private healthcare in just 5 minutes from wherever you choose!

Whether you're looking for quick medical advice, prescriptions or sick notes, we're here to help. Our NHS-trained doctors are available 24/7 to help you with your medical concerns.

We've created a system that allows you to choose your preferred mode of communication. Opt for a phone call, video chat or Skype with one of our healthcare professionals.

settings.title: Sort Out Your Symptoms
settings.text:
Getting professional advice about your symptoms is the best way to get better. Find the most suitable treatment options for your specific concerns and be advised on how to use them.

Our NHS-trained doctors can provide recommendations for medication if needed.

Then, order your treatment from the Welzo online pharmacy for free same or next-day delivery to most areas of the UK.

settings.title: Certified Sick Notes
settings.text:
If you're in need of a fit note (sick note), our GPs are trained to provide you with a certified record of your illness. Depending on the regulations of your workplace, we can provide you with a sick note on day 7 or earlier of your leave.

A fit note is often required by an employer as proof of an illness that hinders an employee's ability to work. This note is proof from a GP that an individual is not well enough, or may be well enough to continue their tasks.

settings.title: Referrals
settings.text:
Our NHS-trained doctors can provide you with referrals for external treatments with specialised medical practitioners.

A referral may be provided if your concern requires specialised support. You and your GP can work together to determine if your concern can be treated without the need for a specialist.

They will evaluate if it is clinically necessary in your case to be referred to a specialist in a particular field.

settings.title: Online Solutions
settings.text:
Online healthcare comes with a range of benefits. You are able to not only choose a time and place for your appointment but you can also have any necessary blood tests, prescriptions or products sent right to your door immediately after your session.

With Welzo, you can take your health back into your own hands. Similarly, if you or someone you care for needs urgent advice, a Welzo doctor is only a few clicks away!

settings.title: Immediate Healthcare at Home
settings.text:
Instead of waiting to be seen by a GP, simply book an online appointment from the comfort of your own home.

Reduce your stress and lay back, now you can receive quality medical attention without the need to travel, meaning you're protecting yourself and others from harm.

settings.title: The Welzo Difference
settings.text:
Healthcare doesn't need to be complicated. That's why we've designed an online GP service that you can cater to your own life. Whether you prefer a phone call, facetime or Skype chat, you can now schedule it for a time and place of your choosing with the added bonus of no waiting rooms!

Now the stress of finding an appointment is gone, you can simply focus on your health concerns and discuss a personalised solution with your online GP.

settings.title: What to expect
settings.text: Unlike other online GP services, Welzo doesn't limit your appointment to just one concern. In your 15-minute session, our qualified doctors can assist you with any problem you need help with - at no extra cost! Then, if you require medication, the Welzo online pharmacy can have it sent to your door with our same or next-day delivery to most areas of the UK!

settings.title: of NHS patients found it too difficult to make an appointment
settings.text: According to the 2022 national NHS survey, 26.5% of patients who needed an appointment said they had avoided making one in the last 12 months as they found it too difficult.

settings.title: of people got an appointment at a time they wanted or sooner
settings.text: According to the NHS GP patient survey findings, only 51.2% of people got an appointment at the time they wanted or sooner.

settings.title: When should you book?
settings.text: You should book an online GP appointment when you are experiencing a health problem, especially if the problem is new or unusual. A GP can help to determine if the issue is likely to require additional support, such as testing or medication.

settings.title: of those surveyed have used an online GP service in the last 12 months
settings.text: According to the 2022 NHS survey, overall, 55.1% of users had used at least one online general practice service in the 12 months before taking part in the survey.

settings.title: Hear from one of our doctors!
settings.text: "Here at Welzo, we know that finding time to go to the GP can often be stressful. That's why we've made it easier for you to have your immediate concerns taken care of. "
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.title: Can I get a prescription from a Welzo online consultation?
settings.text:
Our NHS-trained doctors can recommend a suitable medication for you, which can be ordered from our Welzo online pharmacy immediately after your consultation.

The Welzo online pharmacy requires a short online consultation that will determine if you are suitable for a specific medication before you are able to purchase it. These consultations have been crafted by doctors and are able to decide based on your personal information, medical history and current concerns if you are eligible for a prescription.

settings.title: Can Welzo give me a referral for secondary care?
settings.text:
Yes, if during your consultation, our doctors believe that you require further care, they can provide you with a referral.

Referrals are generally only given to those who have already tried treatments and testing provided by a GP. If you are concerned that your ongoing treatments are not providing adequate support, speak to your GP about further options.

settings.title: Can I get a sick note from Welzo?
settings.text:
Yes, we can provide a sick note to those whose employers require a doctor's note to be eligible for sick leave.

You may be asked about the time you have already taken off due to sickness. This is because the government requires that you give your employer a fit/sick note if you have been ill for longer than 7 days in a row and have taken sick leave. This includes non-working days, such as weekends and bank holidays.

settings.title: What technology should I use for my appointment?
settings.text: The Welzo online GP appointments can be accessed from a phone, tablet or computer. Depending on your preference for a phone call or video call, you may require a device with a camera.

settings.title: How much does it cost per appointment?
settings.text:
A Welzo GP appointment is £49. This price includes any prescriptions, referrals or sick notes that may need to be written during your consultation.

Please note: this will not include the cost of the prescription itself.

settings.title: Can I schedule an appointment for my child?
settings.text: Yes, you are able to schedule an appointment for a dependent aged between 1-16 years. After the age of 16, the individual can schedule and complete their own appointments without the need of a parent or guardian present.

settings.title: Do you offer immediate or same-day services?
settings.text:
We offer consultations in just 5 minutes! If you wish to have your appointment another time, our GPs are available 24/7.

You can schedule an appointment at any time of your choosing, whether that be on the same day or in a week. Welzo allows you to cater your appointments to your life.

settings.title: Will Welzo send any information to my GP?
settings.text: We will not send any information to external sources, including a GP without your consent.

settings.title: How long will be appointment be?
settings.text: Our appointments usually run for 15 minutes. However, if you require additional assistance, our GPs can extend this time to ensure your concerns are attended to.

settings.title: How is an online consultation different from an in-person appointment?
settings.text:
Unlike in-person appointments, our service allows you to choose a time that works for you. This means you won't be held up in waiting rooms or need to relocate to your doctor's rooms.

An online appointment is ideal if you believe that you may be contagious as you won't need to leave your space to be seen to be a doctor. We recommend that in cases of infection, you schedule an online appointment instead of an in-person appointment as this will keep both you and others safe.

settings.title: Will my GP be able to see my medical history?
settings.text:
No, your GP won't be able to see any external medical records, this includes NHS records.

You may be asked about your medical history during your session. This is to ensure that your doctor has all the information they need to accurately determine your illness and how best to treat you.

settings.title: Are there any conditions that you can't provide advice about?
settings.text:
Yes, we are unable to provide advice if you are experiencing an acute injury or serious painful condition such as:

- Major trauma on any part of your body,

- Severe chest pain, a suspected heart attack or stroke,

- Head or neck injuries,

- A neurological defect or seizure,

- Sudden or heavy bleeding,

- Pregnancy-related complications

- Severe mental health issues

- Sudden onset of difficulty in breathing, including persistent breathlessness that may be an asthma attack

- Patients currently completing chemotherapy with suspected neutropenia.

If you are experiencing one of the above conditions and require necessary treatment, you should dial 999 for an ambulance when it's safe to do so.

settings.title: What happens if I have technical issues during my consultation?
settings.text: Please get in touch with our customer support team if you have technical issues during your consultation.

settings.title: Can I use a Welzo online consultation in an emergency?
settings.text:
No, this service should not be used in an emergency.

If you, or someone around you, are in need of immediate medical attention, you should call 999 as soon as possible.

If you are unsure if your concern is an emergency, call the NHS on 111.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions

settings.text: Can't find a time to see your GP? Well, Welzo's got you covered.

settings.title: What is Welzo?
settings.text: Welzo is an all-in-one online healthcare platform that aims to provide its users with fast, simple and effective alternatives to the current healthcare system. Welzo combines a comprehensive library of medical content, a user-based GP service and a vast online pharmacy, all to ensure people are getting the healthcare they deserve.

settings.title: Why was Welzo started?
settings.text: Welzo was created becuase the medical industry was falling behind other newly digitised sectors. That's why Welzo was made as a one-stop shop for an individual's healthcare needs. Now you can learn about your concerns from our talented medical writers, speak to healthcare professionals at the click of a button, and be tested and treated for a variety of concerns, all without leaving your front door.

settings.title: Why should I choose Welzo?
settings.text: If you're looking for a simplified way of sorting out your medical concerns, Welzo might be just what the doctor ordered. While other companies provide singular services, here at Welzo, we do it all. Our customer portal is a state-of-the-art platform where you are able to view your previous test results, ongoing prescriptions and doctor's comments. If you are looking for immediate answers to your queries, you can browse our Health Hub for popular searched-for medical questions, or book an appointment with a GP and be seen in as little as 5 minutes.

settings.title: Where is Welzo located?
settings.text: Welzo is located in London, United Kingdom. Being from one of the busiest cities in the world, we understand how difficult it can be to fit in your health around your full daily life. That's why we've ensured that all of our services can be accessed from the comfort of your home.

settings.title: Learn More About Welzo
